SENT.plain: A 28-year-old Caucasian woman presented with a 12 month history of secondary amenorrhoea, polyuria and polydipsia with fatigue and weight loss
Investigations revealed panhypopituitarism, diabetes insipidus, an intrasellar mass and papilloedema, thought to be due to benign intracranial hypertension
However, a repeat magnetic resonance image showed enlargement of the pituitary mass with compression of the optic nerves
The pituitary abscess was drained by a transsphenoidal approach
Postoperatively the patient received antibiotics with no recurrence of the pituitary abscess
